chapter.title: Tools
chapter.para: The Tools section of the Administration tab is a tool box useful for the day-to-day administration of PMB.

sect1.title: Database cleanup
sect1.para: Database cleanup enables you to remove unused or redundant data, to purge your database of unused authorities.

Here you can also optimize your database by re-indexing it. Removing data from the database, frees more space inside the datafile on the server. This is the only way to maintain a high level of performance from your database server.
Caution : after a database cleanup, always perform a database optimization by clicking on Administration > Tools > MySQL maintenance > Optimize the tables (this will reconstruct the MySQL indexes)

sect1.title: SQL queries
sect1.para: SQL queries are SQL commands lines written in the database.

These SQL queries are created or updated in the administration tab. They are also enabled for users with access privileges in Management. For more details on the Management tab, please read the Management Chapter in the PMB user's guide.
Each stored procedure is shown in an array line. You can edit them by clicking on their title, or execute them by clicking on the button run on the left margin.
You can add parameters : this will allow you to run your stored procedures immediately on screen.
Let's make it simpler.
Suppose I'm a librarian with no SQL knowledge and I want a query that will get me the total count of current loans to borrowers over 65 years old.

I ask my administrator for a stored procedure. He will create a query called "Current loans / > 65 years old" (title example). The SQL code for the query will be a simple ""SELECT COUNT (*) FROM empr, prets WHERE pret.empr_id=empr_id AND (2006-empr_year>=65)"

I can access the query created by the administrator from the Management tab. However for my statistics, I need the same information but for borrowers aged 30 to 65 years old and under 30 years old. Furthermore, I must execute my query every year. In 2007 the previous query will not give the correct results.

The administrator will then create a query with some parameters enclosed between four exclamation marks like !!current_year!! The parameter title may be something like "Please, enter the current year"

Stored procedures are among the advanced features of PMB. To create them you need knowledge of MySQL syntax, to use them simply access Management > Statistics > SQL Queries. This high degree of statistics customization is rarely directly available to the user in proprietary softwares.

sect3.title: Stored procedures : creating a query according to the status of the items
sect3.programlisting: select idcode, codestat_libelle, count(*) as Nombre from exemplaires, docs_codestat, docs_statut where idcode=expl_codestat and expl_section in (!!section!!) and expl_statut='!!status!!' group by idcode, codestat_libelle order by idcode
sect3.para: You have just then to customize the query parameters by clicking on "Configure parameters".

sect3.title: Using parameters in queries

para.emphasis: I have created a Purchase_year text field in the personalised fields of the Exemplaires (items) table. I would like to use it for my own statistics, but I can't find this field in the tables. ?
Here is the query I have created to get the number of items by statistic code :

sect3.programlisting: select idcode, codestat_libelle, count(*) as Nombre from exemplaires, docs_codestat where idcode=expl_codestat group by idcode, codestat_libelle order by idcode

para.emphasis: What must I do to only see at the end of the query the items bought per year Y

sect3.para: Personalised fields don't appear like field in the database but are written in various tables.
About a items field, you have to add in the FROM clause of your query : expl_custom_values, expl_custom and add the filter and join condition in the WHERE clause :
EXPLANATION: filter : creation of a query parameter, you need to click afterwards on "Configure parameters" to validate it.
EXPLANATION: The name of your customized field
EXPLANATION: join condition between exemplaires (items) table and the items customized fields table.
EXPLANATION: the join condition between the field name table and the field value table.
sect3.programlisting: select idcode, codestat_libelle, count(*) as Nombre from exemplaires, expl_custom_values, expl_custom, docs_codestat where idcode=expl_codestat and expl_custom_small_text='!!purchase_year_param!!' and name='Purchase_year' and expl_id=expl_custom_origine and expl_custom_champ=idchamp group by idcode, codestat_libelle order by idcode
sect3.para: CAUTION : Carriage return is not supported in queries.

sect1.title: Database update
sect1.para: If you update PMB version, you will replace all the PMB files by a new version downloaded from www.sigb.net. But this update affect only PMB and not your database. To update the database structure, use Tools > Update database. This update is not destructive. You won't loose any information. You are sure to preserve the integrity of your data and to benefit from the latest new features of PMB.
sect1.remark: This tool is mandatory after a PMB update.
sect1.para: Click on the message "Click here to start the update" to see if your database need updating.

figure.title: Database updates have to be done

sect1.para: In all the next screens (the more your PMB version was old, the more the updates will be numerous), Click on the link click here to proceed.

figure.title: An array displaying the various update actions and their results

sect1.para: Continue to click on the message click here to proceed until you get the message "Your database is up to date in version X.X (this version number is not the same as the PMB version number). You have then ended the database update process.

sect1.title: Table descriptions
sect1.para: This table descriptions correspond to the basic informations on MySQL tables. A deeper documentation is available at the URL http://localhost/pmb/doc/noyau
sect1.remark: "localhost" and "pmb" need to be adapted according to your configuration. "localhost" is the address of your computer or the server where PMB is installed ; "pmb" refers to the installation directory of PMB.

sect1.title: MySQL maintenance
sect1.para: You will find here an interface to the MySQL main maintenance tools : checking, analysing, repairing and optimising tables.
Note MySQL optimisation doesn't correspond to the re indexation accessible from the Database cleanup, PMB manages his own data index.
There are four MySQL maintenance tools :

listitem.para: repair tables. Allows you to repair the database, if the checking or analysing tools have reported errors.
optimise tables. Optimisation allows you to increase the MySQL performance. You should do it regularly.

sect1.title: Parameters
sect1.para: With this tool, you can change/view a lot of parameters from you library name, which will be used on all the documents created by PMB, to the weather displayed in the OPAC, without forgetting various parameters customising ergonomy or even the application structure.
Don't change a parameter value unless you know exactly the effect it will generate, and make a backup before.

The parameters types are listed on the screen. To display the various parameters corresponding to one given type, just click on the + icon to expand a type. Equally, you can use the - icon to collapse the expanded type shown on the screen.
To change a parameter value, click on the line corresponding to this parameter.
When you have saved the changes to your parameter value, the parameter list is displayed again at the same place where you left it. The last changed parameter is highlighted with another color.
